Package org.apache.wayang.core.plan.wayangplan

Class SlotMapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.wayang.core.plan.wayangplan.SlotMapping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class SlotMapping
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This mapping can be used to encapsulate subplans by connecting slots (usually against the data flow direction, i.e., outer output slot to inner output slot, inner input slot to outer input slot).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static SlotMapping wrap​(Operator wrappee, Operator wrapper)
      Creates a new instance where the Slots of the wrapper are mapped to the Slots of the wrappee, thereby matching their Slots by their index (as in Operator.getInput(int) and Operator.getOutput(int)).

      • createIdentityMapping

        public static SlotMapping createIdentityMapping​(Operator operator)
        Create a new instance that maps all Slots of the given Operator to themselves.
        Parameters:
        operator - that will be decorated with the new instance
        Returns:
        the new instance

      • wrap

        public static SlotMapping wrap​(Operator wrappee,
                               Operator wrapper)
        Creates a new instance where the Slots of the wrapper are mapped to the Slots of the wrappee, thereby matching their Slots by their index (as in Operator.getInput(int) and Operator.getOutput(int)).
        Parameters:
        wrappee - the inner Operator
        wrapper - the outer Operator
        Returns:
        the new instance

        Replace the mappings from an old, wrapped operator with a new wrapped operator.

      • compose

        public java.util.Map<InputSlot,​OutputSlot> compose​(SlotMapping that)
        Functionally compose two instances. The OutputSlots of this instance are followed to InputSlots to the other instances, thereby applying the mapping step.
        Parameters:
        that - the instance to be composed to this one
        Returns:
        a Map mapping inner InputSlots of the second instance to the inner OutputSlots of the first one

      • getUpstreamMapping

        public java.util.Map<Slot<?>,​Slot<?>> getUpstreamMapping()
        Retrieves the upstream mapping of Slots. Do not modify!
        Returns:
        the upstream mapping
